_header: Think of the latemost day when we shall faren

BodDig86.First Lines:
Þench of þe latemeste dai hou we schulen fareHout of
                    þisse worlde mid serewe and mid kare…
BodDig86.Last Lines:
…And lete hous hatie þe wou and louien þe
                    riȝtteAnd bringe hous at þen hendedai into heuene liȝtte
                    amen
BodDig86.Facsimiles:
Tschann,  Judith A.,  and  Malcolm B. Parkes.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Facsimile of Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS Digby 86
EETS
         s.s. 16 (1996).
BodDig86.Editions:
Stengel,  Edmund. 
             Coducem Manu Scriptum Digby 86….
         Halle: Orphanotrophei, 1871: 101.

OxfJesus29.First Lines:
I hereþ of one þinge þat ye owen of þencheYe
                    þat weryeþ þat riche schrud and sytteþ on
                    eurebence…
OxfJesus29.Last Lines:
…And lete vs hatye þat wouh and luuþe þat
                    ryhteAnd bringe vre saule to heoueriche lyhte
OxfJesus29.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             An Old English Miscellany: A Bestiary, Kentish Sermons, Proverbs of
                Alfred and Religious Poems of the Thirteenth Century.
EETS
         o.s. 49 (1872); repr. 1988: 168-85.

CamTCC323.First Lines:
Þene latemeste dai wenne we sulen farrenvt of þisse
                    worlde wid pine & wid care…
CamTCC323.Last Lines:
…& lete us hatiin þat wawe & louien þat
                    risteand bring us at hure endesid in to houene liste
CamTCC323.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 46-54.

BLCottCalAIX.First Lines: I hereð of þinge one þat ȝe ohen of þencheȜe þat ƿerieð riche schrud and sitteð on oure benche…
BLCottCalAIX.Last Lines: …And lete us hatie þat ƿoh and luuie[?] þat riȝteAnd bringe ure saƿle to heoueriche liȝteAmen
BLCottCalAIX.Note: 132 lines; sixteen introductory lines. Written as prose.
